item.title: Java help
item.dc:creator: @dogzound5 dogzound5@gmail.com
item.description:
@dogzound5 wrote:

This is main class

public class Animals {
	
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		Dog buddy = new Dog();
		
	
	}

}

Sub Class

public class Dog {
	
		String status = "smelling"
		+ "exploring"; 
		int energy;
		int hunger; 
		int thirst; 
		
		void checkHealth() {
			if(hunger / energy < 50)
				System.out.println("You need more health");
				}
		void showAttributes(int energy, int hunger, int thirst) {
			System.out.println("Energy: " + energy);
			System.out.println("Hunger:" + hunger);
			System.out.println("Thirst:" + thirst);
			System.out.println(status);	
		}
		
		
		
}

The error says the local variable “buddy” is never read

Read full topic

item.description:
@dogzound5 wrote:

What is another way to state a class created a new object then it assigns another object to that name

For instance.

class SuperHero { public static void main(String[] args) { Hero batman = new Hero();

I did that in notepad and wrote another sub class to match the code up, but when I do it in eclipse it says that is an error. What is another way to assign an object a name.

Read full topic
